summary: This document appears to be a jail observation log, likely from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, tracking an inmate on suicide watch or psychological observation. The log details the inmate's activities, meals, and behavior over a period of time. The name 'Epstein' is repeatedly visible in the handwritten notes, indicating this log pertains to Jeffrey Epstein during his incarceration prior to his death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the jail observation log, detailing his activities, meals, and behavior while incarcerated.

events.title: Epstein Under Jail Observation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is documented as being under suicide watch or psychological observation in jail, with logs tracking his meals, liquid intake, showers, and behavior.

keyFacts: The document is a jail observation log for an inmate identified as Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein was on suicide watch or psychological observation, with strict controls on allowed items.
The log meticulously records whether Epstein ate meals, drank liquids, and received showers.
Handwritten notes throughout the document describe Epstein's behavior and activities in his cell.
The document is part of the evidence from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) case files.
